labels.analysis: The Artemis MCP Server is primarily focused on cryptocurrency data retrieval and analysis through the Artemis API. It provides tools for fetching crypto metrics, validating API keys, and generating formulas for data querying in Artemis Sheets. The core functionality revolves around simplifying digital finance operations by enabling easy access to historical and metadata for crypto assets.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Cryptocurrency & Blockchain" was chosen because the server's main use case is interacting with and retrieving crypto-related data. The secondary label "Data Analysis & Processing" was selected due to the server's ability to generate formulas for time-series data analysis. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories sufficiently cover its functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Artemis MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @Artemis-xyz/artemis-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Connect with the Artemis API to retrieve crypto data and generate ART formulas. Simplify your digital finance operations by leveraging powerful tools for data validation and retrieval. Enhance your crypto analysis with easy access to metrics and formulas.

tools.name: get_artemis_data
tools.description: Deploy Server Artemis MCP Server Claim Server @Artemis-xyz/artemis-mcp Try in Playground get_artemis_data

tools.name: get_artemis_supported_metrics_for_symbol
tools.description: Get Metrics that Artemis Supports for a given symbol and their descriptions + sources. Args: symbol: can only take one symbol at a time to get the list of supported metrics for that symbol

tools.name: generate_art_formula
tools.description: Generate an ART formula for Artemis Sheets. This tool creates properly formatted ART formulas for time-series data retrieval such as prices, fees, revenue, and other historical data. Important notes: - Dates must be in YYYY-MM-DD format (e.g., "2025-02-28") - For relative dates, calculate the actual date before passing it to this tool - Order can be "ASC" (default) or "DESC" - Common metrics include: PRICE, VOLUME, MC (market cap), SUPPLY, TVL, etc.

tools.name: generate_artinfo_formula
tools.description: Generate an ARTINFO formula for Artemis Sheets. This tool creates properly formatted ARTINFO formulas for retrieving asset information, classifications, available metrics, market cap rankings, and other metadata. For market rankings: - To get top N assets by market cap, use top_n=N (e.g., top_n=25) - This will generate =ARTINFO("ALL", "TOPn-SYMBOLS") For asset information: - Use parameter1="SYMBOL" (e.g., "BTC") and parameter2="INFO_TYPE" (e.g., "ASSET-NAME", "MC-RANK", etc.)

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Artemis-xyz/artemis-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: artemisApiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Artemis API key to authenticate with Artemis API
